verses.roman:
so 'pi kaiśoraka-vayo
mānayan madhusūdanaḥ
reme strī-ratna-kūṭa-sthaḥ
kṣapāsu kṣapitāhitaḥ

synonyms: saḥ—He; api—especially; kaiśoraka-vayaḥ—the age of adolescence; mānayan—honoring; madhu-sūdanaḥ—the killer of the Madhu demon; reme—enjoyed; strī-ratna—of the gopīs; kūṭa—in multitudes; sthaḥ—situated; kṣapāsu—in the autumn nights; kṣapita-ahitaḥ—who destroys misfortune.
translation: "Lord Madhusūdana enjoyed His youth with pastimes on autumn nights in the midst of the jewellike milkmaids. Thus He dispelled all the misfortunes of the world."

purport.content: This is a verse from the Viṣṇu Purāṇa (5.13.60).
